document.docAuthor: Wang, Jinjin, Li, Xinran, Wang, Zongqing & Che, Yanli
document.masterDocTitle: Four new and three redescribed species of the cockroach genus Margattea Shelford, 1911 (Blattodea, Ectobiidae, Pseudophyllodromiinae) from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Four new and three redescribed species of the cockroach genus Margattea Shelford, 1911 (Blattodea, Ectobiidae, Pseudophyllodromiinae) from China

heading.emphasis:
Key to species of
Margattea
from China

paragraph.keyLead:
1 Tegmina barely reaching middle of abdomen ( Figs. 12, 13 )..........................................
M. hemiptera

2 Hind wings obviously reduced, not reaching the end of abdomen..................................
M. perspicillaris

4 Interocular space relatively narrow, nearly equal to half of distance between antennal sockets ( Figs. 4 , 23 )..
M. angusta
sp. n.
- Interocular space wide, evidently wider than half of distance between antennal sockets ( Figs. 2, 6, 8, 10 , 14 , 32 , 43 , 54 )... 5

6 Supra-anal plate with hind margin concave in the middle............................................
M. trispinosa
- Interstylar margin not produced and nearly truncate........................................................... 9

8 Interstylar region semicircular, hind margin armed with small spines....................................
M. spinifera

- Interstylar region elliptical, lateral margin armed with small spines (
Fig. 40
)...........................
M. flexa
sp. n.

9 Median phallomere with brush-shaped structure at apex...............................................
M. furcata

- Median phallomere with spine-shaped structure at apex...........................................
M. mckittrickae
- Supra-anal plate with hind margin curved and not incised ( Figs. 21 , 50 )......................................... 15
- Subgenital plate symmetrical or almost symmetrical....................................................... 14

13 Styli long and slender, distinctly longer than interstylar space..........................................
M. limbata

- Styli short and robust, approximately equal to interstylar space (
Fig. 62
).......................
M. pseudolimbata
sp. n.

14 Median phallomere with a pair of spinelike sclerites.................................................
M. nimbata

- Median phallomere without a pair of spinelike sclerites..............................................
M. punctulata

16 The accessory structure of median phallomere with brush-shaped sclerite................................
M. speciosa

- The accessory structure of median phallomere without brush-shaped sclerite (
Fig. 22
).....................
M. bisignata

18 Median phallomere forked at apex...........................................................
M. multipunctata

- Median phallomere unforked at apex (
Fig. 51
)..................................................
M. spinosa
sp. n.
